review: Since I've been an Amazon Prime customer, I've wanted a Fire TV and when a great deal came up last month, I ordered one.  I already have Apple TV, so I can't help but compare the two.  The big plus for Fire TV is that it allows access to all the Prime streaming video choices.However, Fire TV seems heavily weighted toward getting users to use paid videos from Amazon.  I can access my Netflix account, but I had to look for user groups online to figure out how to do that, which required downloading the app to the Fire TV.The interface seems a bit clunky.  Apple TV displays all the icons for the various channels/networks such as HBO Go, Vevo Vimeo, YouTube, etc. Fire TV doesn't and I find accessing the various apps is more complicated than it needs to be.  Even accessing the Prime streaming video isn't seamless.  The easiest way to access anything seems to be with the voice recognition on the remote, which works really well.Also, although Apple TV and Fire TV are connected to separate HDMI ports on my television, I have to unplug Fire TV to use Apple TV.  Fire TV doesn't seem to play nicely with other streaming devices.So, I like my Fire TV with reservations.
author: Patti Almonte

Having Prime has it's pluses on ordering off of amazon 2 day delivery if it has the prime written beside it, music, books and movies. Not a one time membership. review: According to the specs on FireTV, this unit can stream up to 7.1 surround sad.  That is NOT true as Amazon does NOT support 7.1 surround sound with the FireTV.  I ordered this because that was an option I definitely wanted (I have a 7.1 surround sound system).  When I couldn't get this to work, I reached out to tech support and was emailed...."I'd like to inform you that at this time, 7.1 audio is not available with Amazon Instant Videos.  I'm sorry".I was also disappointed in the lack of FREE titles available to Prime members.  There are few out there (unless you are looking for a very old title or, for myself personally, a program that wouldn't interest me at all).  Movies and TV shows I would want are "pay per episode" or "pay per season" and those costs are not affordable for me.  A prime example - Damages (which seasons have passed years ago)..Now, the only reason I didn't give it 1 star was for the voice command.  That feature worked PERFECTLY right out of the box.This product has been falsely advertised and marketed as having a capability it does not.  I have lost a great deal of faith in Amazon and their products due to this situation and my experience with their tech support.  Because of that, my Prime Membership will not be renewed on May 3rd.  I'm just really disappointed in Amazon at this point.  After years of continued business I have always been extremely impressed with their wonderful customer service and support.  This instance was a complete FAIL and has left me with a bad taste in my mouth.
